body:
Continue reading for successful strategies on running global, virtual meetings. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
🔹
 
Simple strategies to bridge time zones & cultures for better collaboration
 
 
Looping back... 
⏪
In my last email, we talked about how virtual meetings often leave out key voices due to time zone conflicts and cultural differences. This silent struggle leads to disengagement, miscommunication, and poor decision-making. 
But here’s the good news: 
You can fix this with a few simple yet powerful strategies!
 
 
🕒
 Strategy #1: Rotate Meeting Times Fairly 
💡
 
Respect work-life balance across all regions
 
Instead of expecting the same people to attend inconvenient meetings every time, 
rotate meeting times
 to share the burden equally. If someone has to join at 10 PM one week, make sure it’s someone else’s turn the next. 
✅
 
Bonus Tip:
 Use asynchronous communication (emails, recordings, and message boards) to gather input from those who can’t attend live. 
 
🗣️
 Strategy #2: Adapt to Different Communication Styles 
💡
 
Silence ≠ Agreement!
 
In some cultures, direct disagreement is seen as disrespectful, while in others, debate is encouraged. To create a safe space for all voices: 
✔️
 Allow anonymous feedback for sensitive discussions.
✔️
 Ask direct but open-ended questions like 
"How does this align with your experience?"
 instead of 
"Does everyone agree?"
✔️
 Follow up 1:1 with quieter team members to ensure they feel heard. 
 
📅
 Strategy #3: Clarify Expectations for Time & Deadlines 
💡
 
"ASAP" means different things across cultures!
 
Some cultures prioritize speed, while others value thorough deliberation. To avoid frustration: 
✔️
 Be explicit about deadlines (
e.g., “Reports due by Friday at 5 PM EST, United States”
).
✔️
 Set clear decision-making processes so that no one feels pressured or left out.
✔️
 Use collaborative tools like shared documents where people can contribute in their own time zones. 
 
🤝
 Strategy #4: Build Trust Across Cultures 
💡
 
Trust isn’t universal—it’s built differently everywhere!
 
For some, trust is based on 
credibility
 (titles, experience), for others, it’s about 
reliability
 (doing what you say) or having the opportunity to get to know each other. A successful virtual team: 
✔️
 Establishes 
team norms
 that respect both perspectives.
✔️
 Encourages small talk and informal chats to strengthen relationships.
✔️
 Uses video calls selectively—some team members may prefer writing over speaking. 
 
🚀
 Ready to Make Your Virtual Meetings More Inclusive? 
By making small but intentional changes, you can 
boost engagement, collaboration, and retention
 across your global workforce. 
 
📆
 Let’s chat!
 I’d love to help your team create virtual meetings that work for 
everyone
. Schedule a complimentary call with me today to discuss how to bring these strategies to life in your organization. 
 
👉
 
Schedule your free consultation here!
 
Because when everyone feels valued and heard, 
your entire organization wins.
 
🌟
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza

Hello Tamara!
 
🔹
 
How misaligned expectations are costing your team productivity & engagement
 
 
🛑
 Picture this:
It’s 7:00 AM for Maya in New York, midnight for Carlos in Sydney, and midday for Priya in Mumbai. They’re all logging into the same virtual meeting—cameras on, coffee (or tea) in hand. The agenda is set, but something feels 
off
. 
 
🤔
 The Experience:
🔹
 Maya notices that Carlos is unusually quiet, but assumes he has nothing to add.
🔹
 Priya, used to hierarchical decision-making, hesitates to challenge her senior colleague’s idea.
🔹
 Meanwhile, Carlos, exhausted from yet another late-night meeting, wonders why no one values his work-life balance. 
By the time the meeting ends, there’s a false sense of agreement. But in reality, misunderstandings, cultural differences, and time zone fatigue are eroding trust, engagement, and productivity. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
❌
 Critical voices are being left out due to cultural communication norms.
❌
 Employees are disengaging from meetings that don’t accommodate their time zones.
❌
 Decisions are being made with incomplete input, leading to inefficiency and costly mistakes. 
This isn't just a scheduling inconvenience—it’s a 
barrier to inclusion
 that’s quietly affecting retention, innovation, and collaboration. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where…
✅
 Every employee, regardless of location or cultural background, feels valued and heard.
✅
 Meetings are structured to respect different communication styles and time zones.
✅
 Your global team collaborates effortlessly, leading to stronger, more inclusive decisions. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
Stay tuned for my next email, where I’ll share 
actionable strategies
 to transform your virtual meetings into inclusive, high-impact spaces. 
Because when we break these hidden barriers, we unlock 
true global collaboration.
 
🌎✨
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza

subject: The Power of Us: Building Unified, Collective Movements
body:
First and foremost, Happy Black History Month. We have highlighted some new learning resources below for you to check out to support your ongoing...
 
 
 
First and foremost, Happy Black History Month. We have highlighted some new learning resources below for you to check out to support your ongoing journey. 
Throughout history, social change and civil rights movements have been rooted in shared purpose, collective action and people taking care of one another. From the 
U.S. Civil Rights movement to democratic struggles like Serbia, Chile, and Kenya
, coordinated efforts by citizens were successful because people came together with a unified vision, a commitment to peaceful action, and a willingness to leverage their individual social capital to speak truth to power. 
The last two weeks have been chaotic, with news dropping hourly that sends us reeling. We’ve seen friends and colleagues lose their jobs, seen whole departments dedicated to environmental justice and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion wiped out. It’s disheartening and demoralizing. It’s intended to be. 
That’s the playbook.
To my dear colleagues who have been directly impacted, remember this. The closing of an office does not wipe away the lives you changed with the thousands of thoughtful conversations you facilitated. The “lightbulb” moments you helped people have. The new ideas people took home to their loved ones and shared. The moments of deep, meaningful connection people experienced across their cultural and ideological differences. 
What you do matters and it ripples out.
  
You are water. So let’s flow. What comes next? We stay focused. We coalesce and share information and ideas and support each other. Yes, there is urgency.  It’s also important to take care of ourselves and one another and not fall prey to the “sky is falling” mentality. 
DEI will ultimately continue because it creates healthy, high performing organizations. 
 
The resources we share in this newsletter all offer different perspectives and examples of people working to challenge systems of oppression and doing it through collective action, community organizing, and speaking truth to power. 
Maria Morukian
Founder and Chief Executive Officer
MSM Global Consulting
MSM GLOBAL UPDATES
 
Maria Morukian Featured at the Global HR Forum in Seoul
Back in November, Maria Morukian represented MSM Global Consulting at the prestigious Global HR Forum 2024 in Seoul, South Korea. Presenting to an audience of global leaders and HR professionals, Maria led a session titled "DEIB: Tapping into the Power of Thriving Organizations." The session explored the essential role of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) in fostering creativity, innovation, and sustained organizational success. Attendees gained actionable insights into building inclusive workplaces that empower employees and drive results. 
You can watch Maria Morukian's presentation on YouTube at the following link between minutes
 4:38 to 24:31
. 
Culture Stew
Have you reviewed the Culture Stew Podcast yet? We’d love for you to leave a review—your feedback helps us reach more listeners!
If you haven’t listened to our last two podcasts here they are!  
Revisit This Podcast: "Die Standing with Elmer Dixon"
In honor of Black History Month, revisit this powerful Culture Stew episode featuring Elmer Dixon, co-founder of the Seattle Chapter of the Black Panther Party. Elmer shares his journey from activism in the 1960s to his current role as a global diversity consultant. This episode provides invaluable insights into the ongoing fight for racial equity and the importance of collective action in creating systemic change.
Don’t miss this inspiring conversation: 
Listen here
Transforming Reproductive Justice: Advocating for Incarcerated Women with Dr. Carolyn Sufrin
In our latest Culture Stew episode, host Maria Morukian engages in a compelling conversation with Dr. Carolyn Sufrin, a medical anthropologist and obstetrician/gynecologist dedicated to advocating for the reproductive health and rights of incarcerated women. Dr. Sufrin shares her transformative journey from witnessing the harsh realities of childbirth in custody to leading pivotal research and policy initiatives aimed at systemic reform. This episode sheds light on the intersection of reproductive justice, incarceration, and systemic inequities, emphasizing the urgent need for compassionate healthcare and policy change.
Listen to the full episode here: 
Transforming Reproductive Justice: Advocating for Incarcerated Women with Dr. Carolyn Sufrin
Have you reviewed the Culture Stew Podcast yet? Please do! A short five star review can help get the podcast out to more viewers! 
MSM GLOBAL GALLERY
Here you can find curated content of current DEI issues and events for your further exploration.
 
Global Mentorship Initiative
Building meaningful connections can change lives, and the Global Mentorship Initiative (GMI) is doing just that. GMI pairs experienced professionals with young graduates worldwide, offering career guidance and mentorship to help bridge professional gaps. This global program emphasizes the power of mentorship to foster mutual growth, create opportunities, and build a stronger, more connected workforce. Discover how you can be part of this impactful network.
Learn more: 
Global Mentorship Initiative
Black History Month in the UK: A Global Perspective
While Black History Month originated in the U.S., its celebration has grown worldwide, taking on unique significance in different regions. In the UK, Black History Month emphasizes the contributions of Black Britons to culture, politics, and society. This global perspective offers lessons in solidarity, shared histories, and the ongoing fight for equity. Explore how the UK’s approach can inspire deeper connections across borders.
Learn more: 
Black History Month UK
IDEAS League 
We need community now more than ever in this time of political turmoil. IDEAS Generation is a community of changemakers that is launching the IDEAS League, a year-long community of practice to navigate the uncertainty through dynamic workshops, facilitated strategy sessions, and more. All who are passionate about social change are welcome to join in this necessary and important work! Check out our website for more information: 
https://www.ideasgeneration.org/ideas-league
 
We're waiting for you! 
Would you like to be a guest on the Culture Stew Podcast? 
Do you have a publication we can share on our newsletter or on our social media accounts? 
 
Contact us at 
CultureStew
@MSMGlobalConsulting.com
 TODAY! 
CONTENT FOR YOUR DOWN TIME
Here are some recommended articles and books for your down time.
 
Lies About Black People: How to Combat Racist Stereotypes and Why it Matters
 by Dr. Omekongo Dibinga
 is a timely and indispensable guide for those seeking to navigate the complexities of racial bias and inequality. Dr. Dibinga, a seasoned diversity and inclusion expert, skillfully dismantles harmful stereotypes about the Black community through a combination of personal anecdotes, historical inquiry, and analysis of contemporary events. The book not only exposes pervasive lies, such as the criminalization of Black individuals, but also provides readers with practical tools for self-reflection and confronting their own biases. With a focus on re-education and the importance of dismantling harmful narratives, Dr. Dibinga’s work is an invaluable resource for anyone committed to fostering understanding, taking action, and contributing to the ongoing fight for racial equality in our society.
 
Afrocentric Voices in Classical Music
Classical music is often viewed through a Eurocentric lens, but Black composers and performers have significantly shaped its history. Afrocentric Voices in Classical Music shines a light on these contributions, celebrating the rich legacy of Black artists in this genre. Explore this resource to discover trailblazing musicians whose work transcends borders and fosters a deeper connection to global cultural diversity.
Learn more: 
Afrocentric Voices
Chevalier
“Son of an African slave and a French farmer, Joseph Bologne, Chevalier de Saint-Georges, achieves an unthinkable position in society as a famous violinist, composer and fencer, in addition to experiencing an ill-fated love affair.” 
Learn more here.

subject: 🌍 Mastering Nonverbal Cues for a Truly Inclusive Workplace 🤝
body:
Continue reading for strategies to build the nonverbal gap in your workplace. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
💡
 5 Ways to Decode Nonverbal Cues in Global Teams 
🌎✨
 
🔗
 Let’s Recap: 
In my last email, I shared how nonverbal miscommunications—like differing eye contact norms, gestures, and silence—can unintentionally create 
exclusion and misunderstanding
 in culturally diverse workplaces.  
Today, I’m giving you a 
quick guide
 to navigate these differences with confidence. 
 
🔑
🔑 
Here are 
five key strategies
 to bridge the nonverbal gap and build a more inclusive, culturally aware team:
 
1️⃣ 
Recognize That Silence Speaks Volumes
In some cultures, silence signals 
respect and thoughtfulness
, while in others, it may indicate 
discomfort or disengagement
. Instead of assuming, create space for follow-up by saying, 
“I’d love to hear your thoughts when you’re ready.”
 
 
2️⃣ 
Decode Eye Contact Expectations
While steady eye contact may signal confidence in Western workplaces, it can be perceived as challenging or disrespectful in some Asian or Middle Eastern cultures. Encourage flexibility and awareness, ensuring employees feel respected regardless of their cultural background. 
 
3️⃣ 
Adapt Your Gestures Wisely
A simple thumbs-up 
👍
 may mean “great” in the U.S., but in parts of the Middle East, it’s offensive. Instead of relying on gestures, clarify meaning through words and be mindful of cultural differences. 
When in doubt, observe before assuming
. 
 
4️⃣ 
Pay Attention to Personal Space
Some cultures prefer close proximity during conversations, while others value more space. Be adaptable in meetings and interactions—when in doubt, mirror the other person’s comfort level to foster positive engagement. 
 
5️⃣ 
Lead with Curiosity, Not Assumptions
Encourage an 
open dialogue about cultural differences
 in your team. A simple question like, 
“How do people in your culture typically show agreement or disagreement?”
 can create a culture of learning and respect rather than confusion or frustration. 
 
🚀
 
Ready to Build a More Inclusive Workplace?
Bridging these nonverbal differences isn’t just a 
nice-to-have
—it’s a 
powerful strategy
 that transforms workplace culture. If you’re ready to take 
the next step
, let’s talk! 
Schedule a complimentary call
 with me, and let’s craft a strategy for a more inclusive, engaged workforce. 
 
📅
 
Book Your Free Call Now
 
 
 
Here’s to creating workplaces where cultural differences matter! 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

subject: 🚀 Unlocking Inclusion: The Hidden Language of Global Workplaces 🌍
body:
Continue reading to learn how nonverbal communication can impact the workplace. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
❓ ❓ 
Are Nonverbal Cues Holding Your Inclusion Efforts Back? 
🤔
 
🛑
 Picture this:
 
You’re leading a global team meeting, and while one employee remains silent, another nods frequently but never speaks up. Later, you find out the silent employee felt disrespected, while the one nodding actually disagreed with your proposal. Confused? You’re not alone. 
 
🤔
 The Experience:
Nonverbal cues—eye contact, gestures, posture—can vary dramatically across cultures. A thumbs-up might be encouraging in one country but offensive in another. In Western workplaces, direct eye contact signals confidence, but in many Asian cultures, it can be seen as aggressive. These subtle differences can lead to 
misunderstandings, frustration, and even disengagement
 among your culturally diverse workforce. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
When nonverbal communication isn’t understood, 
trust breaks down, collaboration suffers, and employees feel excluded
—even when inclusion is your top priority. Without addressing these hidden barriers, even best-laid plans can fall short, leaving employees feeling disconnected rather than empowered. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine a workplace where 
cultural nuances are understood and respected
—where leaders recognize silent agreement, where gestures build trust instead of confusion, and where every employee, no matter where they’re from, feels truly seen and heard. This isn’t just a dream—it’s an achievable reality when nonverbal communication is embraced as part of your cultural competence development strategy. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
In my next email, I’ll share 
a simple, actionable guide
 to decoding nonverbal cues in global workplaces. You’ll get 
practical strategies
 to help you and your team navigate cultural differences with confidence and clarity.  
Stay tuned! 
👀
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences

subject: Psychological Safety is a Health and Safety Issue, and it’s Time We Treated It That Way
body:
The truth is: if people don’t feel safe to speak up, contribute, or challenge, they’re not truly safe.
 
 
Dear colleagues,
We hope 2025 has begun with promise and positivity for you and yours.
 
This year, the world is at a pivotal moment. As global headlines are dominated by significant political shifts, such as Trump's re-election, and corporate giants like META redefine their EDI commitments, the need for meaningful change has never been more urgent. It's time for organisations to take a hard look at their approach to EDI - evolving strategies and focusing more strongly on impact and actions that truly make a difference.
In this action-packed edition, you'll find: 
Why 
Psychological Safety is a critical Health and Safety issue
, and how to address it effectively
An invitation to our 
"Beyond SRA Compliance – Inclusive Leadership for a Thriving Culture"
 event
Exciting details about our 
International Women's Day
 workshops
Insights from our CEO in "
EDI Is Evolving - And It’s Time to Act!
"
A snapshot of our 
2025 predictions
 shaping the future of EDI
An opportunity to join our 
audiobook competition
!
 
Click on the links below to dive deeper into each topic.
 
As always, we’re here for any questions or additional information you may need.
 
Let’s make 2025 a year of real progress!
 
Warm regards,
Your 
Included
 Team 
  
Psychological Safety is a Health and Safety Issue - And It’s Time We Treated It That Way
When we talk about health and safety at work, we often think about physical risks - safety protocols, fire drills, and injury prevention. But there’s another critical element that’s often overlooked: psychological safety.
Psychological safety isn’t a "nice-to-have" or a soft issue - it’s a fundamental requirement for organisations that want to foster inclusion, retain talent, and build trust. And this is where Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI) comes into play.
 
Read now
 
Beyond SRA Compliance – Inclusive Leadership for a Thriving Culture
Join us for an exclusive free 60-minute, online event designed for HR and People professionals working in law firms and legal teams on Thursday 6 February 1200-1300 GMT.
 
The Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA) has set a clear mandate for accountability, inclusive practices, and cultural transparency. But are you leveraging these regulations to create lasting change and embed inclusive leadership at the highest levels?
Sign-up here
 
International Women’s Day 2025: Accelerate Action
In 2025, the world stands at a crossroads. With global headlines dominated by political shifts, such as Trump’s re-election, and evolving corporate strategies like META and Amazon’s reshaped DEI commitments, there’s a pressing need to accelerate tangible action on gender equity. This year’s sessions focus on equipping organisations and teams to navigate these challenges while advancing a bold, urgent vision for equity.
 
Find out more
 
EDI Is Evolving - And It’s Time to Act!
With recent events focusing attention on Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI), 
Included’s
 CEO, Michelle Sequeira, encourages you to take a step back and consider the bigger picture.
Resistance to progress is nothing new – history shows us that meaningful change is often met with pushback. From civil rights movements to LGBTQIA+ rights, every major shift has faced challenges. But these challenges are proof that change is happening...
 
Read more
 
Predictions for EDI in 2025
Here we look ahead to predictions for 2025, including areas such as AI and data analytics, pay equity and transparency, sustainable ESG, global EDI standardisation and many others.
  
Read more
 
The Key to Inclusion Audiobook
 
We are delighted to share that our book, 
The Key to Inclusion
, is soon to be available in audio format. This book, written in 2022, is a practical guide to Diversity, Equity and Belonging for You, Your Team and Your Organisation. Recognising the importance of diversity, belonging and equity is not enough and this book has the practical guidance needed to think differently and make true inclusion a reality.
To mark this exciting moment, we are offering you the chance of winning a free audio book code. Please visit the below link for further information. Good Luck!

Hello Tamara!
 
💡
 
Ready to turn silent misunderstandings into meaningful connections?
 
 
🔗
 Let’s Recap: 
In my last email, we uncovered a silent challenge: misreading or ignoring nonverbal cues in culturally diverse organizations. 
These subtle signals—eye contact, gestures, tone of voice—carry significant meaning. But when they’re misinterpreted, they can lead to disengagement, tension, and missed opportunities to create a truly inclusive culture. 
The good news? With the right strategies, you can unlock the power of nonverbal communication to foster understanding and connection. 
 
🛠️
 Actionable Strategies to Bridge the Nonverbal Gap 
1️⃣ 
Educate Your Team on Cultural Differences
Host training sessions that focus on how nonverbal cues vary across cultures. For example, some cultures see direct eye contact as a sign of confidence, while others view it as disrespect. Building awareness is the first step to creating empathy and reducing misinterpretation. 
 
2️⃣ E
ncourage Curiosity, Not Assumptions
Train employees to approach nonverbal cues with curiosity rather than judgment. A simple question like, “
I noticed you were quiet in the meeting—what are your thoughts?
” can uncover valuable insights and show respect for cultural norms. 
 
3️⃣ 
Practice Active Observation
Teach your team to tune into patterns of nonverbal behavior rather than isolated actions. This helps avoid jumping to conclusions based on a single moment. Patterns provide context and reveal a deeper understanding. 
 
4️⃣ 
Model Inclusive Nonverbal Behavior
Leaders set the tone. Encourage managers to use open body language, welcoming gestures, and active listening cues. These small shifts can create a more inclusive atmosphere where employees feel seen and respected. 
 
5️⃣
 
Incorporate Feedback Loops
Regularly check in with employees to understand how communication styles are impacting their experience. This feedback ensures that cultural nuances are recognized and addressed over time. 
 
🌟
 Imagine the Impact: 
Picture this: 
Meetings where diverse perspectives flow effortlessly because everyone feels understood. 
A team culture rooted in mutual respect and curiosity about one another’s unique ways of communicating. 
A workplace where nonverbal signals strengthen, rather than strain, collaboration. 
This is the power of cultural competence in action. 
 
📅
 Let’s Build This Together: 
Want tailored strategies to help your team navigate the nuances of nonverbal communication? Schedule a 
complimentary call
 with me today. Together, we’ll design a roadmap to bridge the cultural communication gap and empower your workforce. 
 
👉
 
Click here to schedule your complimentary call.
 
 
Here’s to creating workplaces where every gesture matters! 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

subject: 👀 Is Your Workplace Missing Critical Nonverbal Cues?
body:
Continue reading to recognize how communication goes beyond words. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
❓
 
What if cultural misunderstandings are silently derailing your inclusion efforts?
 
 
🛑
 Picture This: 
In today’s culturally diverse workplaces, communication goes far beyond words.  
Body language, eye contact, gestures, and even silence carry powerful meanings. But here’s the catch: these signals often differ across cultures. 
What’s a sign of confidence in one culture could be interpreted as arrogance in another.  
A pause before responding might signal respect—or discomfort.  
When these cues are misread, it’s like a silent storm brewing under the surface of your workplace dynamics. 
 
🤔
 The Experience: 
Imagine a culturally diverse team in a meeting. 
One employee avoids direct eye contact, which their colleagues interpret as disengagement. A manager sees a team member’s reserved posture as a lack of confidence, unaware it reflects cultural humility. 
Now, imagine how it feels for these employees: 
Misunderstood, as their actions are judged through the lens of someone else’s norms. 
Disconnected, because they don’t feel truly seen or respected. 
Stressed, trying to adjust their natural behaviors to fit expectations they don’t fully understand. 
 
⚠️
 The Problem: 
When nonverbal communication is overlooked or misinterpreted, it creates hidden barriers to inclusion: 
Employee disengagement:
 Team members may feel judged or undervalued. 
Increased conflict:
 Misread cues can lead to unnecessary tension or resentment. 
Missed opportunities:
 Diverse perspectives are stifled when employees don’t feel comfortable contributing. 
These silent missteps undermine trust, collaboration, and ultimately, your DEI goals. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For: 
Now imagine this: 
A workplace where managers and employees recognize and respect cultural differences in nonverbal communication. 
Teams that adapt their interactions to make everyone feel included and valued. 
A culture where understanding and connection thrive—no words are lost in translation. 
This is the foundation of a truly inclusive workplace, where every individual feels empowered to bring their full selves to work. 
 
🎤
 What’s Next: 
In my next email, I’ll share 
practical strategies
 for recognizing and navigating cultural differences in nonverbal communication.
These actionable tips will help you bridge the gap and create a workplace where connection and collaboration come naturally. 
 
Stay tuned—you won’t want to miss this!
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

New course | Welcome to the LIONS Growth MBA
body:
Take a journey with Fernando Machado and LIONS Learning
 | 
View in browser
 
 
 
Today’s marketers face a lot of challenges. With mounting pressure on short-term results and an increase in risk-averse stakeholders, organisations often find comfort in plain, purely rational work.
 
But the reality is that creativity is the last unfair business advantage when it comes to marketing. Few people know that better than 
Fernando Machado
. Through his work with Burger King, Dove, NotCo and Activision Blizzard, he's proved that creativity leads to growth – time and time again.
 
Now, he’s bringing everything he’s learnt in his almost 30-year career to you.
 
Over 10 weeks, Fernando himself will give you the practical tools and frameworks to advocate for creativity in business across every part of your organisation.
 
Ready to join the class?
 The first of only two cohorts this year starts 
6 April
. Now’s the time to register your interest – and be part of history in the making.
FIND OUT MORE
 
The course
at a glance
 
Bringing a lifetime of learnings and expertise from one of the industry’s most awarded chief marketing officers to your screen, Fernando will lift the curtain on great work – introducing you to creative leaders who’ve stuck their neck on the line over and over again to make great creative work happen – and got the results to prove it.
 
Through a combination of pre-recorded masterclasses and interviews, plus live sessions with legendary creative minds from around the world, you’ll explore topics like the importance of brand positioning, how to write a great creative brief, mastering product innovation and how to suck less as a client (yes there is a module about this!)
 
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
 
  
With up-close access to the industry’s best, plus actionable lessons on how to turn their teachings into real-life results, the LIONS gMBA is learning you can’t find anywhere else.

subject: 🚀 Transform Your ERGs into Drivers of Inclusion and Impact
body:

Hello Tamara!
 
💡
 
Ready to turn your ERGs into powerful tools for engagement and empowerment?
 
 
🔗
 Let’s Recap: 
In my last email, we explored a common challenge: ERGs that fail to live up to their potential, leaving underrepresented employees feeling unsupported and organizations falling short of their inclusion goals. 
The good news? You can change that. With the right strategies, your ERGs can become a driving force behind your DEI+ efforts, fostering connection, innovation, and trust across your organization. 
 
🛠️
 Actionable Strategies for Thriving ERGs 
1️⃣ 
Define Clear Objectives and Alignment
ERGs thrive when they have a purpose. Collaborate with members to outline specific goals, such as professional development, community engagement, or policy advocacy. Align these goals with your organization’s broader DEI+ strategy to ensure their impact is both visible and valued. 
2️⃣ 
Secure Leadership Buy-In
Support from leadership isn’t just helpful—it’s essential. Engage senior leaders as ERG sponsors or champions. They can provide resources, amplify initiatives, and advocate for group priorities. Their backing shows that ERGs matter at the highest levels. 
3️⃣ 
Ensure Adequate Resources
An ERG without resources is like a car without fuel. Allocate funding for events, training, and initiatives. Provide platforms for communication and collaboration and ensure ERG leaders have the time and tools to succeed. 
4️⃣ 
Recognize and Reward Contributions
ERG leaders and members often work tirelessly to create impact—acknowledge their efforts! Recognize their contributions through awards, promotions, or professional development opportunities. When employees see the value placed on ERGs, participation grows. 
5️⃣ 
Measure Impact and Adapt
Use surveys, feedback, and key metrics to track the progress of your ERG initiatives. What’s working? What’s not? Regularly assess and adapt strategies to ensure the groups remain effective and responsive to employees’ needs. 
 
🌟
 Imagine the Impact: 
Picture a workplace where ERGs drive real change: 
Employees feel valued and connected. 
Leadership embraces diverse voices. 
Innovation and collaboration thrive. 
This is what’s possible when ERGs are empowered to succeed. 
 
📅
 Let’s Take Action Together: 
Want personalized guidance on building impactful ERGs tailored to your organization? Schedule a 
complimentary call
 with me today. Together, we’ll create a roadmap to foster a workplace where every employee can thrive. 
👉
 
Click here to schedule your complimentary call.
 
 
Here’s to creating spaces where every voice matters! 
Bye for now, 
Luiza

subject: 🌍 Are Your ERGs Unlocking True Potential?
body:

Hello Tamara!
 
❓
 
What if your organization’s ERGs could go beyond meetups to become game-changers for inclusivity?
 
 
🛑
 Picture This:
Your organization has invested in Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), envisioning a space where underrepresented employees feel supported, seen, and empowered. But over time, participation dwindles, leadership loses interest, and ERGs struggle to create meaningful impact. 
These groups have the potential to drive connection, innovation, and inclusivity—but without the right support, they risk becoming token gestures instead of transformative tools. 
 
🤔
 The Experience: 
Imagine an underrepresented employee joining an ERG with high hopes. They’re seeking a community where they can voice concerns, build camaraderie, and grow professionally. 
Instead, they encounter: 
Meetings that feel directionless. 
Limited resources or organizational buy-in. 
A sense that their contributions aren’t taken seriously. 
They walk away feeling even more isolated and disheartened. 
 
⚠️
 The Problem: 
For your organization, this isn’t just an ERG issue—it’s a culture issue. 
When ERGs underperform: 
Talented employees disengage, leading to turnover. 
A lack of trust in leadership grows. 
Efforts to create a truly inclusive culture stall. 
It’s like planting seeds in rocky soil—there’s potential, but nothing flourishes. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For: 
Now, imagine this: Your ERGs become the heartbeat of your inclusion strategy. 
Picture: 
Thriving groups with clear goals aligned with organizational values. 
Active participation and leadership support that amplify ERG initiatives. 
A workplace where diverse employees feel empowered, valued, and equipped to thrive. 
This isn’t a dream. It’s the reality of an inclusive, high-performing culture built on the power of well-supported ERGs. 
 
🎤
 What’s Next: 
In my next email, I’ll share 
actionable strategies
 to help your ERGs not only survive but thrive.  
Together, we’ll explore how to turn these groups into the cornerstone of your inclusion efforts. 
 
Stay tuned! You won’t want to miss these tips for driving meaningful change! 
 
Here’s to transforming your workplace, one empowered employee at a time. 
Bye for now, 
Luiza

Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

subject: 🛠️ Unlock the Power of Inclusive Communication with These 4 Strategies
body:
Continue reading for strategies to bridge the communication gap in your team ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
💡
 It’s time to turn communication challenges into opportunities for growth and collaboration. 
In my last email, we explored how differences in communication styles can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts, quietly undermining trust and inclusivity within your team.  
The good news? These gaps aren’t insurmountable.  
With the right strategies, you can transform these challenges into strengths. 
✍️ 
Here are 
4 actionable strategies
 to help your team navigate communication differences and build stronger connections: 
 
1️⃣ 
Normalize Conversations About Communication Styles
 
Encourage team members to discuss their preferred ways of communicating. Use tools like personality assessments (e.g., DISC, MBTI) to help identify and share these preferences. When teams understand one another’s styles, they can adapt more effectively. 
 
2️⃣
 Establish Clear Communication Norms
 
Set team agreements for communication, such as “assume positive intent,” “ask clarifying questions before reacting,” or “use culturally appropriate feedback.” These norms create a shared framework that reduces misunderstandings. 
 
3️⃣ 
Train for Active Listening
 
Equip your team with skills to listen without interrupting, paraphrase to confirm understanding, and respond empathetically. Active listening helps bridge cultural and communication gaps, ensuring everyone feels heard. 
 
4️⃣ 
Bring in Cultural Competence Training
 
Provide training that highlights how cultural backgrounds influence communication styles. This equips your team to approach differences with curiosity and respect, making your workplace more inclusive. 
 
🌈
 Imagine This Future:
 
With these and other strategies, you can create a workplace where collaboration flows seamlessly, misunderstandings are rare, and every voice is heard and valued. You will also be able to foster a team environment that thrives on respect, inclusivity, and trust—building the foundation for long-term success. 
 
🚀
 Ready to Take Action?
Which of these strategies will you introduce first?  
Remember, small shifts can lead to significant changes.  
If you’d like tailored guidance to implement these tools, let’s connect—I’d love to help you create a communication framework that works for your team. 
Here’s to better conversations and stronger teams! 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

That’s what the State of Creativity 2024 study showed us. But it’s not always easy to get buy-in from the whole business. How can you convince your C-suites that investing in creativity isn’t just a nice-to-have?
 
In this year’s State of Creativity study, we’ll be shifting the focus to embracing and reframing risk, so you can use it as your year-round tool to prove the business case for creativity. 
 
This is your opportunity to shape the study and help us solve the challenges you’re facing.

And as a thank you, if you complete the full survey you’ll have the chance to win a place on either the

Make your advertising work better more consistently and more predictably in this six-week course that’ll equip you with a deep understanding of the fundamental and evidence-based principles of advertising effectiveness.
 
The State of Creativity is produced by LIONS Advisory – your partner in building cultures of creative effectiveness. We’d love to hear from you if you have any ideas or would like to discuss the State of Creativity further.

subject: 🗣️ Are Communication Gaps Costing Your Team’s Success?
body:
Continue reading to learn more about differences in communication styles. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
❓ ❓ 
What if the way your team communicates is unintentionally holding back innovation and inclusivity?" 
 
🛑
 Picture This:
  
In today’s culturally diverse workplaces, teams bring unique perspectives, shaped by different cultural backgrounds, communication styles, and life experiences.  
These differences can be a strength—if harnessed effectively. But all too often, they lead to misunderstandings, frustrations, and missed opportunities for collaboration. 
 
🤔
 The Experience:
 
Take a moment to step into the shoes of your team members.  
Imagine an employee who prefers direct communication feeling blindsided by vague feedback from a colleague who favors a more indirect approach.  
Or a manager misinterpreting a team member’s silence during a meeting as disengagement, when in reality, they come from a culture where listening is prioritized over speaking. 
These small disconnects add up, leading to tension, unspoken conflicts, and a decline in team morale. For employees, this can feel like walking on eggshells—unsure of how to express themselves without causing friction. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
 
Your team’s struggles with navigating these communication differences could be silently eroding trust, collaboration, and performance.  
Without intentional strategies to bridge these gaps, the same challenges will keep resurfacing, making it harder to foster an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and heard. 
 
💡
 The Future You’re Waiting For:
 
Now, imagine this: a team where everyone understands and respects one another’s communication styles.  
Feedback is clear and constructive.  
Differences are celebrated, not divisive.  
Meetings are more productive. 
Conflicts are resolved faster. 
And innovation flourishes because every voice is truly heard. 
This is the inclusive, high-performing workplace culturally competent leaders can create—and it starts by addressing how your team communicates. 
 
🎤
  What’s Next:
In the next email, I’ll share a list of actionable strategies your team can use to navigate differences in communication styles and resolve conflicts effectively. Stay tuned—you won’t want to miss this! 
 
Here’s to building teams that thrive on collaboration and inclusion!
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

subject: Transcending the Bluster of the DEI Backlash
body:
The news and social media over the last few months has been filled with headlines tolling the bell for DEI...
 
 
 
The news and social media over the last few months has been filled with headlines tolling the bell for DEI, with some major corporations like McDonald’s and Walmart pulling back their DEI efforts. Even a recent teaser for an Apple TV show “
The Studio
” includes a quip about the demise of DEI departments. It’s easy to get lost in all the noise, which leads to anxiety, confusion, panic, and stasis. 
Let’s take some time to get up out of the noise so we can view the entirety of the situation with a broader perspective. Here are some high level points to keep in mind.
The workforce population is exponentially more diverse, but leadership is still overwhelmingly White and Male
The U.S. is more racially and ethnically diverse than ever, and the 
White population has declined by almost 9% since 2010
. The 
f
oreign born population is increasing and by 2030 will be the main source of population growth in our nation
. The number of people identifying as 
LGBTQ+ has steadily risen in the last decade and is now over 7%
 of the overall population. The predominantly White Baby Boomer population is rapidly heading toward retirement and the next generation of leaders, workers, and consumers is much more diverse. Yet, 
89% of CEOs, COOs, and CFOs are White, and 88% are men
. 
Plain language: The population is on track to be majority non-White within the next few years, but there is a massive overrepresentation of White men in senior leadership positions considering their population size. Organizations are not prepared for the mass exodus of the aging workforce.
  
Employees generally see DEI as helpful, but many White employees have qualms
The population is on track to be majority non-White within the next few years, but there is a massive overrepresentation of White men in senior leadership positions considering their population size. Organizations are not prepared for the mass exodus of the aging workforce.
Studies have shown that most employees believe DEI is good for their organizations, with numbers ranging from 
50-80% depending on the study
. Over 
80% of Gen Z job seekers
 indicate that an organization’s commitment to DEI is a significant factor in their employment decisions. However, the share of workers agreeing that DEI is a good thing has abated slightly in the last year, 
from 56% to 52%
, and is lowest among White men. One interesting finding from a Pew study was that although more Americans overall say DEI practices help Black, Hispanic and Asian men and women, a much higher number of White people in comparison with other races and ethnicities say DEI efforts hurt White workers. In fact, 
47% of White adults say DEI practices in the workplace hurt White men and 29% say they hurt White women
.
Plain language: Although DEI efforts are generally well regarded, particularly by the incoming generation of workers, White people are more likely to believe these efforts hurt them. Organizations need to ensure that DEI policies, practices, and communications are inclusive of all constituencies and White folks can see themselves as contributors of the solution rather than perpetrators of the problem.
DEI is in the crosshairs of policy and politics, but the fundamental work continues
More than 
30 states introduced bills banning or limiting DEI initiatives
, and several states succeeded in fully banning DEI offices at public universities. 
The Dismantle DEI Act
 was introduced in Congress, aiming to ban diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) programs and funding in the federal government. This bill, if passed, could have a sweeping impact on federal agencies as well as any corporate entities doing business with the government. 
The Supreme Court is set to rule in 2025
 on a case claiming “reverse discrimination” that could set an alarming precedent for corporate DEI efforts down the road.
Although these legal efforts do have a significant impact and chilling effect on DEI efforts, it’s important to look closely at what they actually prohibit and what is still permissible. For the most part, the fundamental work of DEI should remain untouched by these legal changes. DEI at its core is about actively seeking ways to expand the pool of qualified candidates representing the full marketplace of talent. It’s about creating policies and practices where everyone has access to opportunities to develop, advance, and thrive. DEI is about cultivating organizational cultures that honor, value, and respect everyone, inspire diversity of thought, and maximize employee engagement. 
Plain language: Yes, policies will be put into place that may dampen or eradicate some efforts, but the work can and will continue because it is not only legal, it’s imperative for organizational growth and sustainability. Organizations need to work closely with legal counsel to stay up to speed on changing laws and requirements and reinforce policies that uphold fairness and inclusion for all.
Practicing Transcendence
I spoke in an earlier post about the 
Orbital Perspective
, when astronauts exit Earth’s orbit and look back on the planet for the first time from a different vantage point. They are faced with a sobering contradiction, seeing the immense beauty of the planet while recognizing the darkness of poverty, hunger, war, and injustice. When we are able to create some distance from the chaos, it gives us the opportunity to experience a deeper level of empathy for all humanity, and to explore possibilities that might not be present for us when we’re down on the ground surrounded by the noise.
Using this new perspective, consider the following:
How are we creating organizations that support a more diverse workforce and engaging in succession planning to prepare the next generation of leaders?
How are we listening to and engaging with all members of our constituencies, including White folks?
How can we stay informed of upcoming policies and future proof our work so that it is sustainable?
To balance out this very pragmatic and data filled post, let’s end with some art:
These lines come from a poem called “Stars” by Yaffa AS, a queer Muslim poet and activist. This particular poem caught my attention because it reminds me of the concept of transcending the static and reminded me that our work is unending. The bell will never toll on our collective movement toward human flourishing.
i am a movement you can’t quench
i am a not a thought you can extinguish
 
Maria Morukian
Founder and Chief Executive Officer
MSM Global Consulting
MSM GLOBAL UPDATES
 
We’re easing into the new year with exciting plans and meaningful projects! One highlight is our upcoming Leadership Program in Texas, where Maria will facilitate a two-day training for people managers. This program will focus on essential leadership skills, including: 
Foundations of effective leadership
Core values and leadership
Stages of team development
Giving and receiving feedback
Professional learning and personal development is at the heart of our work, and we’re committed to helping organizations thrive. Our 
Course Catalogue
 is an excellent resource for exploring the breadth of programs we offer. From leadership development to DEI strategies, our offerings are designed to meet your unique needs. Take a look and connect with us to discuss how we can partner with you to achieve your goals! 
Culture Stew
Have you reviewed the Culture Stew Podcast yet? We’d love for you to leave a review—your feedback helps us reach more listeners!
If you haven’t listened to our last two podcasts here they are! 
Holding Up the Mirror: Reimagining DEI and Systemic Change with Wendy Moomaw
In this thought-provoking episode, Maria Morukian speaks with Wendy Moomaw about what it means to reimagine DEI work to create systemic change. Wendy shares insights on holding up the mirror to examine organizational values, power dynamics, and opportunities for genuine transformation. This episode is a must-listen for leaders and change-makers who are ready to deepen their impact.
Protecting Your Peace and Sustaining Momentum for Social Change
In a world where burnout and pushback can derail even the most passionate advocates, this episode explores how to protect your peace while sustaining momentum for meaningful change. Maria discusses strategies for resilience, self-care, and staying true to the mission of equity and inclusion, even in challenging times.
 
We have some exciting episodes planned for 2025 starting next week. Stay tuned for our first podcast of the year, releasing on Wednesday, January 15th!
MSM GLOBAL GALLERY
Here you can find curated content of current DEI issues and events for your further exploration.
 
Inclusalytics: How Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Leaders Use Data to Drive Their Work
Written by organizational psychologists Victoria Mattingly, PhD, and Sertrice Grice, MS, with award-winning author Allison Goldstein, Inclusalytics is a must-read for DEI leaders aiming to take a data-driven approach to their work. Through stories from the DEI consulting field, organizational science, and interviews with leaders across industries, the book offers a clear roadmap to using data to measure and enhance DEI strategies. With step-by-step guidance on gathering, analyzing, and leveraging data, Inclusalytics empowers readers to treat DEI as a critical business metric—ensuring sustainable progress and demonstrating ROI. Ideal for DEI professionals, people leaders, and anyone committed to fostering workplaces where everyone can thrive.
Brookings Institution: “Generative AI, the American Worker, and the Future of Work”
This insightful article explores the transformative potential of generative AI on the American workforce. It delves into how AI technologies may reshape jobs, industries, and the skills workers need to thrive in the future. The piece also raises critical questions about equity, inclusivity, and how organizations can ensure that these technological advancements benefit all workers, not just a select few. A must-read for leaders navigating the intersection of technology and human capital.
Exploring the Power of “Calling In” with Loretta J. Ross
In her TED Talk (
Don’t Call People Out—Call Them In
), Loretta J. Ross challenges the divisive culture of "calling out" and offers a compelling case for "calling in" as a more constructive and compassionate approach to addressing harm and fostering accountability. Building on these ideas, her book 
Calling In: Ending Racism in America
 dives deeper into how we can create meaningful dialogue, embrace restorative practices, and cultivate environments where growth and understanding are prioritized over conflict. Together, these resources provide practical tools and inspiring insights for anyone committed to equity, inclusion, and social change.
Together, these resources underscore the critical connections between data-driven decision-making, technological advancement, and compassionate leadership in shaping the future of work. Inclusalytics equips DEI leaders with tools to measure and sustain progress, treating DEI as a vital business metric. The Brookings Institution’s insights on generative AI highlight the need for inclusive strategies to navigate the transformative impacts of technology on the workforce. Finally, Loretta J. Ross’s work on “calling in” invites us to prioritize empathy and restorative dialogue as we address inequities and foster accountability. Collectively, they offer a roadmap for building workplaces that are innovative, equitable, and centered on human flourishing. 
We're waiting for you! 
Would you like to be a guest on the Culture Stew Podcast? 
Do you have a publication we can share on our newsletter or on our social media accounts? 
 
Contact us at 
CultureStew
@MSMGlobalConsulting.com
 TODAY! 
CONTENT FOR YOUR DOWN TIME
Here are some recommended articles and books for your down time.
 
“Hope for Cynics” by Jamil Zaki
This thought-provoking essay by esteemed Stanford psychologist and neuroscientist Jamil Zaki explores the importance of cultivating hope in a cynical world. Zaki’s piece is a refreshing reminder that empathy and optimism are powerful tools in the face of adversity, especially when dealing with systemic challenges like DEI backlash. It’s a quick yet impactful read that inspires resilience.
Blood Orange by Yaffa AS
A powerful poetry collection by queer Muslim poet and activist Yaffa AS, Blood Orange blends personal and political themes with striking emotional depth. These poems serve as both a call to action and a balm for the soul, reminding readers that resilience and creativity are essential in the face of struggle. The collection is a fitting companion to the newsletter’s overarching themes of persistence and transcendence.
Additionally, this MASGD’s curated list of books highlights the lived experiences of queer Muslims across various contexts. These stories celebrate intersectionality, providing valuable perspectives that are often overlooked in mainstream discourse. They’re perfect for readers seeking deeper understanding and empathy for marginalized communities.
Playlist: "Resilient Rhythms"
 
Unwind and recharge with this curated Spotify playlist featuring uplifting and thought-provoking tracks from artists like Alicia Keys, Hozier, and Koffee. Each song is carefully selected to remind listeners of the beauty of human connection and the power of perseverance, creating a perfect backdrop for moments of reflection and self-care.

We specialize in organizational culture change by empowering organizations to achieve greater success through embracing equity, diversity and inclusivity. We provide a holistic approach to organizational development, team capacity building, and leadership development. Let us know what would be helpful for you in this newsletter.

subject: 🌟This Week’s DEI+ Spotlight: 🌍 Overcoming Resistance to DEI: Strategies for Building Buy-In and Driving Change
body:
Continue reading to learn strategies for overcoming DEI resistance, plus free resources. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear Tamara,
Have you ever faced resistance to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives in your organization?
It’s a challenge many HR leaders encounter—but overcoming this resistance isn’t just a corporate responsibility; it’s a business imperative. 
In the latest DEI+ newsletter article, 
Overcoming Resistance to DEI: Strategies for Building Buy-In and Driving Change
,
 I explore: 
Why resistance arises and how to counter common objections. 
Strategies for engaging resistant groups and fostering connection. 
The measurable costs of ignoring DEI—and the transformative benefits of prioritizing it. 
This article is packed with actionable insights to help you navigate tough conversations and turn skepticism into commitment. 
 
👉
 Read the full article here.
 
To complement the article, check out my 
YouTube video, Illuminatus: The DEI Pendulum
.
 It’s a powerful metaphor for how organizations transform from resistance to collaboration and embrace the power of inclusion and belonging. You’ll also find a downloadable discussion guide to help you lead impactful DEI conversations with your team. 
Let’s work together to create workplaces where everyone feels valued and empowered.  
If you’d like tailored guidance for your DEI journey, schedule a 
complimentary call
 with me today. 
 
Looking forward to helping you drive meaningful change!
Bye for now!

subject: ✍️ 5 Tips to Revamp Job Descriptions and Attract Diverse Talent 🌟
body:
Continue reading for strategies to revamp your job descriptions. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
 
☀️
 
A few small tweaks to your job descriptions can open the door to talent you never knew you were missing.
 
In my last email, we talked about how current hiring practices can unintentionally exclude diverse candidates.  
Barriers like gender-coded language, inflexible requirements, and limited outreach are preventing your organization from reaching its full potential.  
But the good news? You can fix this—starting today. 
Here are 
5 actionable tips
 to make your job descriptions and outreach strategies truly inclusive: 
 
1️⃣ 
Use Gender-Neutral Language:
Job ads that include gendered terms (e.g., "rockstar," "dominant") can deter women or nonbinary candidates from applying. Tools like Textio or Gender Decoder can help you identify and replace these words with neutral alternatives. 
 
2️⃣
 
Focus on Skills, Not Credentials:
Replace rigid degree requirements with skills-based qualifications. For example, instead of "MBA required," try "experience in team leadership and financial strategy preferred." This opens the door for candidates with nontraditional backgrounds who bring unique perspectives. 
 
3️⃣
 
Emphasize Commitment to DEI:
Include a statement about your commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Highlight initiatives or ERGs (Employee Resource Groups) to show candidates they’ll be valued and supported. 
 
4️⃣
 Expand Your Candidate Pool:
Rethink where you’re posting your jobs. Partner with organizations and job boards that focus on underrepresented groups, like Black Professionals in Tech or the National Society of Hispanic MBAs. Broaden your reach beyond your usual channels. 
 
5️⃣ 
Involve Diverse Perspectives in Writing:
Collaborate with employees from different backgrounds to review job descriptions. They can spot unintentional biases or language that might not resonate with diverse candidates. 
 
💡
 
Imagine This Future:
When you take these steps, you’ll notice a profound shift. More diverse applicants. More unique perspectives. A workplace culture enriched by voices that bring fresh ideas and innovation. 
 
🚀
 Ready to Take Action?
The first step to change is awareness—the next is action. Start applying these tips today and watch your talent pool grow in ways you didn’t think possible. 
 
Bye for now, 
 
 
 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)

subject: Subject: 🔍 Are Your Job Descriptions Keeping top Talent Away?
body:
How to attract diverse talent without bias. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara
 
❓ ❓ 
What if your hiring practices are unintentionally turning away the very talent your organization needs to thrive? 
 
    
🛑
 Picture this:
Your organization has ambitious DEI goals, but the candidate pool isn’t reflecting the diversity you’re striving for. Despite your best intentions, the resumes coming in feel like they belong to the same demographic over and over again. 
 
   
🚶‍♀️ 
The Experience:
For candidates, a job description will either inspire them to apply or deter them entirely.
Imagine a talented individual from an underrepresented group reading a job post filled with jargon, corporate clichés, or inflexible requirements.  
They might feel excluded, undervalued, or that your organization isn’t a good fit for them.  
And just like that, they move on—taking their unique perspectives and skills with them. 
 
⚠️ 
The Problem:
Your current job descriptions and outreach strategies might unknowingly contain barriers.  
These could include gender-coded language, overly strict requirements that alienate diverse talent, or sourcing strategies that limit access to underrepresented groups.  
The result? Missed opportunities to bring in top-tier talent who could drive innovation, inclusion, and success. 
 
   
💡
  The Future You’re Waiting For:
Imagine job postings that resonate with a diverse audience, inspiring them to envision themselves thriving in your organization.  
Envision hiring managers equipped with the tools to identify and eliminate biases in the recruitment process.  
Your organization becomes a beacon for talent, known for creating opportunities where everyone feels valued and welcomed.  
With the right strategies, this isn’t just a dream—it’s an achievable reality. 
 
   
🎤
  What’s Next:
In my next email, I’ll share actionable tips for revamping job descriptions and crafting outreach strategies that truly attract the best and brightest from all walks of life.  
Get ready to reimagine your hiring process with inclusion at its heart. 
Here’s to building a workplace where everyone belongs! 
💼🌍
 
 
Bye for now, 
Luiza
___________________________________
 
Luiza Dreasher, President and CEO (she/her/hers)
Mastering Cultural Differences

In global teams, perceptions of 
favoritism
 can damage trust and morale: 
Leaders from 
high power-distance cultures
 naturally prioritize senior voices. 
Employees from 
low power-distance cultures
 feel excluded, undervalued, and disengaged. 
 
The result?
🚩
 
Innovation stalls.
 Diverse ideas go unheard.
🚩
 
Morale dips.
 Team members feel alienated.
🚩
 
Trust erodes.
 Collaboration and productivity suffer. 
But you can change this. 
 
✨
 
Introducing the Global Academy
 
✨
An online course designed to help leaders balance power dynamics and foster inclusivity. 
What you’ll gain:
✅
 
Practical tools
 to ensure every voice is heard—regardless of rank.
✅
 
Strategies
 to build trust and collaboration in culturally diverse teams.
✅
 
Insights
 into balancing respect for hierarchy with a culture of equality. 
 
Imagine this:
🌟
 Teams where 
all perspectives are valued
, sparking innovation and creativity.
🌟

build trust
 and eliminate the frustrations of favoritism.
🌟

Continue reading so you don't miss out on our special offer. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hello Tamara!
In a bustling open-plan office, a global marketing team is hard at work preparing for a major product launch.  
Yet beneath the surface, frustration is simmering. Meetings drag on, deadlines slip, and what should be a powerhouse of innovation feels disjointed. 
The team is a microcosm of global diversity. On one side, Amina, a strategist from Kenya, thrives in brainstorming sessions where ideas are built collectively, aligning with her collectivist cultural background.  
On the other, Jake, a data analyst from the U.S., prefers working independently, polishing his ideas before presenting them to the group—a reflection of his individualist values. 
 
Same Project, Different Experiences
For Amina, the constant push for individual work feels isolating. She misses the synergy of collective problem-solving and feels her input isn’t valued.  
Meanwhile, Jake grows frustrated during long team discussions, feeling they waste time he could use to refine his analysis.  
Both are starting to disengage, convinced their approaches don’t fit the team’s rhythm; and without clear processes to balance these differing work styles, the team is at a standstill.  
 
When Cultural Differences Are Respected and Understood
 
Imagine if this team had a leader who understood these cultural divides and embraced them.  
Picture a workplace where group brainstorming sessions are followed by focused, independent work time—allowing both styles to shine.  
With a structured approach, Amina and Jake could play to their strengths, bringing richer ideas to the table. 
By respecting and harmonizing these differences, the organization could unlock its team's full potential: 
Collaboration would flourish
, with clear processes aligning everyone. 
Efficiency would soar
, as delays caused by miscommunication disappear. 
Innovation would thrive
, with diverse perspectives fueling groundbreaking solutions. 
This isn’t just a dream—it’s a reality waiting to happen.
With the right systems and training, cultural divides can transform into bridges, leading teams to greater success.
 
🌏
 
 
🌎🌎🌎
 Introducing the Global Academy
 
The
 Global Academy
 equips leaders with tools to bridge cultural divides in working styles. This transformative online course offers: 
Insights into cultural differences impacting global teams.
Strategies to create balanced workflows that align diverse preferences. 
Tools to build a workplace where differences become strengths. 
👉
 
Click here to learn more about the Global Academy!

Luiza

As the year winds down, we continue a season of celebration observed in diverse ways across the globe. 
Whatever traditions you cherish, I hope this time is filled with joy, connection, and meaningful moments with those who matter most.
I’m truly grateful for the connection we’ve shared this year and for your continued support in fostering a world of inclusion, respect, and understanding. Together, we are making strides toward building communities and workplaces where everyone feels they belong.
May your holiday season be filled with peace, and may this spirit of togetherness carry into the new year and beyond.
Wishing you safety, wellness, and harmony as we look ahead to 2025!
-- Luiza Dreasher, Mastering Cultural Differences

subject: Happy Holidays from Atomico
body:
A reflection on a huge year at Atomico
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Happy Holidays from Atomico!
2024 has been a huge year for Atomico, our founders and partners. Here we take a look at some of the most exciting developments in our universe over the past twelve months, as we pause and reflect for 2025.
We continue to build at pace for the benefit of the most exciting founders of our generation, our investors and the European technology ecosystem. Thank you to those of you that have partnered with us this year. 
We announced our largest ever fundraise of $1.24 billion
September saw the announcement of two new Atomico funds totalling $1.24 billion to support Europe’s most gamechanging founders. The final number represents a more than 50% increase on Atomico V, our previous $820 million fund.
Since inception we’ve partnered with founders from series A, expanding to include growth investments in 2011. This fundraise allowed us to formalise this strategy under dedicated venture and growth funds, with a specialised team for each stage of maturity.
See our Growth Partner Laura Connell discuss how we’re putting this capital to work, 
live on Bloomberg
.
 
And welcomed 9 new founders
The year has seen spectacular new firms join the Atomico portfolio, as well as the opportunity to double down on some of our most exciting companies. Those that have been announced publicly include:
Berlin’s 
deeploi
, boosting SMBs with smarter IT management
Modernising accounting for the $14 trillion shipping industry, with 
Harbor Lab
 from Chalandri in Greece
Copenhagen’s 
Light
 - the first AI-powered general ledger for global company finances
Following on with Cambridge’s 
Healx
, who are leveraging AI to treat rare diseases
The world’s most advanced AI security platform, Zurich’s 
Lakera
Doubling down on virtual clinic for substance use management, 
Pelago
Accelerating the clean energy transition with London’s 
tem.
Increasing productivity with your new shortcut to everything, 
Raycast
San Francisco’s 
/dev/agents
 - the next generation operating system for AI agents 
  
We launched our tenth State of European Tech
A decade of the State of European Tech means we really do have a LOT of data, and we were determined to use it to provide not only a snapshot of where the ecosystem lies today, but a much longer-term view. Read the report to understand the past, present and future of European technology, including some unique forecasts about what’s to come. 
State of European Tech Report >>
 
Producing the first ever documentary about the European technology ecosystem
In just a few weeks 100,000 people have watched our documentary about the growth and progress of the European technology ecosystem, featuring its most influential voices. These include Spotify and Neko Health’s Daniel Ek, Seedcamp’s Reshma Sohoni, Adyen’s Pieter van der Does, Plural’s Taavet Hinrikus, Booking.com’s Gillian Tans, Techcrunch’s Ingrid Lunden, Wayve’s Alex Kendall and too many more to name.
Essential holiday viewing.
 
As The State of European Tech celebrates its tenth anniversary, the team has gathered the most influential voices in the ecosystem for a landmark documentary to discuss the past, present and future of European tech.
We made Conscious Scaling public
Sustainability is at the core of Atomico’s strategy, investment philosophy, mission and values. Since 2015 we have been embedding environmental, social and governance considerations into all our working practices. This year, for the first time, we made our progress, and that of our portfolio, public through our Conscious Scaling report.
Read our Conscious Scaling report >>
 
 
Now it’s time to pause and reflect
Read more about Atomico Founder and CEO, Niklas Zennström's thoughts about why 
European technology needs a shift in mindset
 for 2025. 
We wish you all a restful holiday period and look forward to reconnecting in the new year.
 
 
 
Copyright © 2023, Atomico, All rights reserved.

subject: 🌟 This Week’s DEI+ Spotlight:🌍 Is Miscommunication Undermining Your Global Team?
body:
Continue reading to understand why it is difficult for some groups to say 'no.' ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
 
 
View in Web Browser
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Dear Tamara,
Have you ever assumed a "yes" meant agreement—only to discover it didn’t? 
🤔
  
This common misstep in global teams can derail projects, strain relationships, and erode trust. 
In some cultures, saying "no" directly is considered rude or confrontational, leading to ambiguous responses that are easily misunderstood.  
Without cultural awareness, team leaders and colleagues may unknowingly perpetuate frustration, missed deadlines, and diminished team morale. 
But here’s the good news: 
🌟
 By understanding and addressing these cultural nuances, you can foster a workplace where communication flows smoothly, misunderstandings are minimized, and cultural diversity becomes your team’s greatest asset.  
Imagine leading a team where cultural differences are celebrated, timelines are clear, and collaboration drives innovation. 
Don’t let cultural misunderstandings hold your team back! 
👇 👇
 Click the link below to read our latest article, 
The Silent ‘No’: How Cultural Differences Impact Team Communication,
 
and discover actionable strategies to transform your team’s communication and performance. 
 
🔗
 
Read the full article now
.
 
 
Let’s turn cultural differences into strengths, together! 
💪
 
 
 
👉 
👉 
👉 
 
CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE ARTICLE
 
Bye for now!
Luiza
